definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: This guy looked like a beaten-up spider-monkey mutant.
sentences.chinese: 這個傢伙看起來活像個蓬頭垢面的蜘蛛猴變種人。

sentences.english: A new variety of Acorus of Araceae.
sentences.chinese: 天南星科菖蒲屬一新變種。

sentences.english: The plumbothorite discovered for the first time is a new variety of thorite.
sentences.chinese: 鉛釷石是釷石的新變種，屬首次發現。

sentences.english: Through microscopic observations researchers identified up to 61 morphospecies.
sentences.chinese: 研究者通過顯微鏡的觀察鑑定了總共61個變種。

sentences.english: It should be expanded to include the strain now causing sickness in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 對於現今在歐洲引發疾病的病菌變種也須實施監控。

sentences.english: The breed is only one in a gallery of bizarre variations of the common goldfish.
sentences.chinese: 這個品種的金魚，只是普通金魚衆多的奇異變種之一。

sentences.english: The quagga was a strikingly beautiful variant of the zebra.
sentences.chinese: 斑驢是一種極美麗的斑馬變種。

sentences.english: A dry red wine made from the black grape variety Cabernet sauvignon.
sentences.chinese: 用卡勃耐變種黑葡萄製成的一種乾紅葡萄酒。

sentences.english: Of them, 8 new species and new pathovar were discovered in China.
sentences.chinese: 其中由我國發現的新種和新致病變種8個。

sentences.english: New species and varieties of Myrsinaceae from China.
sentences.chinese: 中國紫金牛科新種及新變種。

sentences.english: New species and varieties of Malvaceae from China.
sentences.chinese: 標題中國錦葵科植物的新種和新變種。

sentences.english: There are intermediate varieties known as cannel coal.
sentences.chinese: 有一些中間性的變種，叫做燭煤。

sentences.english: Two new varieties of Camellia chrysantha from Kwangsi.
sentences.chinese: 廣西金花茶的兩個新變種。

sentences.english: In fact, mutant mice that have no circadian clocks tend to be chunky.
sentences.chinese: 比如無生物鐘的變種小鼠身形就趨於矮胖。

sentences.english: There are many variations you can use to customize your advice.
sentences.chinese: 還存在着許多你可以使用的變種以定製你自己的通知。

sentences.english: That genus of plants differentiates into three species.
sentences.chinese: 那個屬種的植物衍生出三個變種。

definition: to extinguish/to become extinct/to die out
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
